body:
> can you explain the change from `[0]` to `[1]`?

@felixcheung , This is because of the problem caused by this [ZEPPELIN-2619](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/commit/085efeb646f3a95b39bf555b5b04551119e3c0b9).

This feature has been running in our company for 2 years and there is no problem.
Will merge if no more comments.

@liuxunorg Based on the above comments, I think we should keep the old shell interpreter as the batch mode and the new shell interpreter as interactive mode.  Personally I prefer to keep them in one interpreter group so that they can be launched in one JVM and collaborate with each other.

Regarding the `interpolations`, it should already support, as it inherits `AbstractInterpreter` which support `interpolations`.
ok. do you think we should add more tests for ZEPPELIN-2619?
hm. I guess we need a plan to move to 2.11

I tried to do that, but some other interpreters don't support scala-2.11. So it would take much more time to support scala-2.11 fully in zeppelin. I plan to move some interpreter out of zeppelin project to subproject, so that each interpreter can has its own build environment and dependency. This PR is a temporary solution before that
@felixcheung , More busy, I suggest to find out the problem and solve it. :-)
Any news on this?
sure, this could be a big problem...
LGTM

@Leemoonsoo I enabled travis and it took a few force-push-retries for all the jobs to succeed in one run.
Now it seems that the travis_check.py script has had some error in the Jenkins job.
Will merge if no more comment
Yes, this file is no longer needed.
This problem blocked the compilation, Will merge if no more comments.

The changes have been completed in accordance with the https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3359#issuecomment-492935457.

Nice!
One thought: Is the "any chars" needed for some common guard against running empty paragraphs, or could any chars actually be no chars?
I feel it is a bit confusing for end users to have to provide some text that doesn't matter just to start the interpreter.

@FireArrow , Yes, Because the paragraph limits the input you must perform.
So `%sh.terminal` needs to enter a few char to execute.

I also considered this question:
1. Is it necessary to control whether a paragraph must have input to execute?
2. If there is input, it can only be in the interpreter's configuration file.
Add a configuration item that the specified interpreter can execute without entering characters.

I add new issue, solve this problem. https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3371
CI green. Shall I merge this, if no more concerns?

@zjffdu , @felixcheung , Please help me review code. Thanks! :-)
[[ZEPPELIN-4131] Refactoring shell interpreter](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3359) need this PR.
LGTM
CI Green (https://travis-ci.org/prabhjyotsingh/zeppelin/builds/537396824) will merge this to master.
Will merge if no more comments

#### `%sh.terminal` runs directly, No need to enter any extraneous characters.

![terminal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3677382/58472508-fa7c0080-8178-11e9-8989-699159f266ad.gif)
Is it not enough?
Thanks for late response, +1, will merge it soon
@pellmont we've been looking for a feature just like this one, are there any plans to finalize this PR? Can we help in anyway?

@liuxunorg Thanks for the PR. I left a few comments. Overall I don't think it is proper to do it in injection approach. A lots of cluster deployment specific logic is injected into Interpreter, RemoteInterpreterServer and etc. I think cluster deployment is another kind of launch approach, we should move them out of the standard interpreter classes to make them decouple of these basic classes.
Ping
@conker84 I am busy on other stuff recently, but make some progress on this. The plan is still completing it before 0.9 which is planed to be released this summer.
Will merge if no more comments

can you describe how this is fixed? the PR description looks like the issue reported in the JIRA

is this the fix> https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-3946?focusedCommentId=16802582&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-16802582

or something else?

Hello everyone
I have a problem with zeppelin; the notebook does not run and displays the following message
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: scala.tools.nsc.interpreter.ILoop.scala$tools$nsc$interpreter$ILoop$$loopPostInit...


and in log zeppelin-interpreter-spark-hduser-ubuntu.log

 INFO [2019-06-01 14:17:09,785] ({pool-2-thread-2} NewSparkInterpreter.java[open]:83) - Using Scala Version: 2.11
ERROR [2019-06-01 14:17:33,290] ({pool-2-thread-2} NewSparkInterpreter.java[open]:124) - Fail to open SparkInterpreter
ERROR [2019-06-01 14:17:33,290] ({pool-2-thread-2} Job.java[run]:190) - Job failed
org.apache.zeppelin.interpreter.InterpreterException: Fail to open SparkInterpreter
	at org.apache.zeppelin.spark.NewSparkInterpreter.open(NewSparkInterpreter.java:125)
	at org.apache.zeppelin.spark.SparkInterpreter.open(SparkInterpreter.java:62)
	at org.apache.zeppelin.interpreter.LazyOpenInterpreter.open(LazyOpenInterpreter.java:69)


version scala 2.11.12
version zeppelin 0.8.0
version spark 2.4.1

can someone help me plz ?

When connecting to a database through a database connection pool, If there is no sql operation for a long time, The database connection pool will actively close this connection. The connection between the client and the database is broken.

So by increasing
```
poolableConnectionFactory.setValidationQuery("show databases");
```
Periodically call the `show databases` statement, Keep the connection to the database.
Will merge if no more comments
Will merge if no more comments
@liuxunorg Could add add your last comment to the PR description ?
I edited it
@felixcheung , Thank you! :-)

@felixcheung , Can you tell me how to solve these problems?
> 1. for all dependencies changes, they should listed/updated in LICENSE file

I do not quite understand, Can you tell me how to amend it?

> 2. we can't include .so or any binary files in source repo. This is against release policy in ASF.

I will deal with this problem.

> 3. certain file seems like in category X (eg. GPL) that we, as a policy in ASF, cannot release https://apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-x

I do not quite understand, Can you tell me how to amend it?

1. for the new dependencies, in the pom file https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3359/files#diff-ba629e2dbade35aef7a022f6bc745bc1 check their license (see the source repo) against  https://apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-x, then see https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/LICENSE

2. .so, .exe, .dll etc cannot be in the git source repo...

3. I think this was largely the binaries
Will merge if no more comments

@felixcheung 

`libpty` is distributed under EPL license 
https://github.com/JetBrains/pty4j#license

It falls into "WEAK COPYLEFT" LICENSES according to the link you posted above
https://apache.org/legal/resolved.html#weak-copyleft-licenses 

So it's a `Category B` open-source software 
https://apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-b

And according to the same ASF link it has to be included in binary and not source code form -
```
Unless otherwise specified, all Category B licensed works should be included 
in binary-only form in Apache Software Foundation 
convenience binaries (and not source code).
```

Thanks for the info. @Tagar 
I think we could include the binary distribution of `libpty` as long as meet the `APPROPRIATELY LABELLED CONDITION` by declaring it clearly in `README` file.

I add License description & add download-libpyt shell script, [CI Pass](https://travis-ci.org/liuxunorg/zeppelin/builds/541561476)

Please help me review, Thank you!

@zjffdu , I re-implemented it again, The logic is much clearer.
1. Added `plugins/ClusterLauncher`
2. Create an interpreter process on other zeppelin servers by means of message broadcasts.
3. Remove the old way to create interpreter processes on other zeppelin servers via the thrift interface.
4. Added `ClusterManagerTest` , `ClusterMultiNodeTest` and `ClusterMockTest` test case.

Please help review, Thank you!

Hi @zjffdu,
Is this being also added to 0.8.2 or just the master?

I don't see any blocker other than comment on 2.12 and fair scheduler mode


Any more comments?  :-)

will merge this if there are no more discussions
will merge this if there are no more discussions
On top of this, `spark.jars.packages` also doesn't work. It shows the JARs in UI but in import, it can't find them.
Can you add some unit test to cover this ?

There are already test cases,  https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-plugins/notebookrepo/filesystem/src/test/java/org/apache/zeppelin/notebook/repo/FileSystemNotebookRepoTest.java#L111

But `FileSystem` has some differences in the two different file systems, the `local file system` and `HDFS`. 

### FileSystem::move(src, dest)
+ In the local file system, the parent directory of dest can be created automatically if it does not exist.
+ In the HDFS file system, the parent directory of dest will fail if it does not exist.

To be clear the ASF page clearly states:

BINARY-ONLY INCLUSION CONDITION
Unless otherwise specified, all Category B licensed works should be included in binary-only form in Apache Software Foundation convenience binaries (and not source code).

This means we should not have cat B binaries in git repo which is the source code.

We need to find another way to package them into binary release without having them in source release (or source code/ source repo)

https://apache.org/legal/resolved.html#binary-only-inclusion-condition

if they are cat b, it's ok in the build process they are downloaded and packaged into the -bin binary package

please check the license for these dependencies
I see, thanks @liuxunorg +1
Will merge if no more comments
